revised_title: Proceedings of the Royal Society Annual Meeting, June 1, 1876
tldr: The Royal Society held its annual meeting on June 1, 1876, to elect new fellows. The meeting approved the election of several candidates, including Capt. William de Wiveleslie Abney and Prof. Henry Edward Armstrong. The society also admitted the Right Hon. B. Disraeli as a member and acknowledged the presents received. Several papers were read during the meeting.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science and Technology
